main event: Unidentified metallic object hovered over Lubbock, Texas for six minutes before moving east and disappearing into a cloud bank. A formation of bright lights in the sky near Lubbock, Texas was also observed by multiple witnesses, with the lights being described as oval or circular in shape, amber in color, and traveling at a high rate of speed in a northerly direction.
interesting points: Multiple sightings of bright lights in the sky near Lubbock, Texas on August 25, 1952, by reliable witnesses.
The metallic object in Lubbock hovered for six minutes before disappearing into a cloud bank.

The formation of lights was observed to be at an estimated altitude of approximately 1,000 feet and traveled a distance of approximately 5 to 15 miles before disappearing, lasting for about 10 to 15 minutes.

The observed objects were described as luminous, circular in shape, and estimated to be 30 to 50 feet in diameter, flying at an estimated altitude of 2000 to 3000 feet and traveling at an estimated speed of 600 to 800 mph.
Atmospheric conditions on August 2, 1952, in Lubbock were noted to have a temperature of 78.1 degrees and visibility of 15 miles with scattered clouds at 30,000 feet.
sighted object: Unidentified metallic object and formation of bright lights in the sky
